page.title: 03HOOK NORTON-BANBURY RAILWAY
page.content: HOOK NORTON WAS ONE OF 17 STATIONS ON THE G.W.R.,BANBURY TO CHELTENHAM LINE. THE LINE WAS SINGLE-TRACK,BUT WHEN IT CAME TO HOOK NORTON STATION, IT SPLIT INTO 3 TRACKS & HAD 3 PLATFORMS.TWO OF THE TRACKS CONTINUED ON & ONE STOPPED. ON PLATFORM 1 THERE IS A LOADING DOCK FOR CATTLE,(BEHIND IT IS THE RAILWAY INN WHICH STILL STANDS TODAY.) IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION THERE IS A GOODS SHED, THE TWO TRACKS JOIN TO ONE AND TRAVEL OVER 2 MASSIVE VIADUCTS (THE PILLARS STILL STAND). AFTER THAT THE TRACK TRAVELS INTO A TUNNEL AND ON TO ROLLRIGHT HALT.THE RAILWAY LASTED TILL THE BEECHING CUTS OF THE 60'S AND PART OF IT IS NOW A NATURE RESERVE. BRYMBO IRON WORKS WERE ABOUT A MILE FROM THE STATION. THERE WERE 4 KILNS AND OWNED 2 LOCO'S AND SOME TRUCKS FOR TRANSPORT. DURING THE DEPRESSION,IT STARTED LOSING MONEY AND CLOSED DOWN.
